  • Module 2
    • Introduction to structured decision making in natural resources management
    • History, rational, and applications of decision making in natural resources and conservation
    • Types of decision making philosophies in natural resources
    • Structuring and quantifying objectives
    • Decision making and working with stakeholders
  • Module 3
    • Statistics and decision making: Estimating current system states-I
    • Statistics and decision making: Estimating current system states-II
    • Using data to estimate parameters and quantify uncertainty
    • Predicting outcomes in a decision context: linear models
    • Predicting outcomes in a decision context: generalized linear models
    • Predicting outcomes in a decision context: hierarchical linear models
    • Estimating current states (marked populations): abundance
    • Estimating current states (marked populations): survival
    • Estimating current states (marked populations): survival & abundanc
    • Estimating current states (marked populations): multi-state
    • Estimating current states (unmarked populations): Occupancy
    • Estimating current states (unmarked populations): multi season and state occupancy models
    • Estimating current states (unmarked populations): Closed and open N-mixture models
    • Introduction to influence diagrams
    • Using graphical models to predict outcomes
    • Eliciting and quantifying expert judgment
  • Module 4
    • Influence diagrams and decision alternatives
    • Choosing the best decision alternative and evaluating the effect of uncertainty-I
    • Choosing the best decision alternative and evaluating the effect of uncertainty-II Monte Carlo Simulation
    • Sensitivity analysis and estimating the value of information
    • Introduction to optimization
    • Case study I-Setting harvest regulations
    • Case study II-Invasive species control
  • Module 5
    • Conflict resolution and knowledge acquisition through adaptive management
    • AM: More than just trial and error
    • Learning from monitoring in AM
    • Prioritizing learning: Passive versus active AM
    • Case study-black duck management
    • Case study-Golden Eagles and trail closures in Denali National Park
    • Case study-reconnection of fragmented habitats
    • Case study-Adaptive management of horseshoe crabs and red knots
    • Advanced topics in SDM and AM: Risk and extreme uncertainty
